segments.text: I can't believe how absorbed that woman is in her dish drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is practically gushing over the sink, and she's just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit of irritation watching her ignore the obvious disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t she realize how the floor is turning into a slip hazard?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the boy is climbing dangerously high, reaching into the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hold my breath, fearing what will happen if he loses his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little feet are wobbling, and I can hardly watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks completely mesmerized, her arm reaching up in anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s sweet but infuriating at the same time; they’re so oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout, to warn them, but I’m frozen in my spot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can this woman not see what’s happening beside her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast of the tidy garden outside just emphasizes the chaos within.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels like a bomb waiting to go off, and I can't do anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to protect them, but I’m just a silent observer in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can only hope they come out of this unscathed.
segments.speaker: PAR
